dialogues.text: Stanton will destroy you if you persist. Freddie, this is not a war you can win. But Aiken is gone, as we CUT TO -- ...The SOUND of screeching across a stone floor.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK
dialogues.text: A GUARD pushes a CART down the second-story CATWALK, stop in front of DAVID HEROLD's CELL. He passes a TRAY inside. HEROLD receives the BEER and SANDWICH, his FINAL MEAL. LEWIS PAYNE chews on a FAT CIGAR. GEORGE ATZERODT cradles a BOTTLE of BOURBON.

dialogues.speaker: PULL BACK
dialogues.text: Aiken enters with Mary's TRAY. He raises the cover

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Boiled oysters!

dialogues.speaker: AIKEN
dialogues.text: And some laudanum to calm the nerves. Aiken hands her a small bottle filled with liquid.

dialogues.speaker: MARY

dialogues.text: I forbid you.

dialogues.text: If I can produce your son, you just might live.

dialogues.text: If you "produce" my son, they will hang him alongside of me.

dialogues.speaker: AIKEN
dialogues.text: You don't know that. For God's sake, Mary, make Father Walter tell us where they're hiding him.

dialogues.text: I'll do no such thing. Some day, John will be found. (MORE )

dialogues.text: This is my fault.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Hold your tongue. She glances at Aiken.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: He knows, Ma. He knows I pushed John into this.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: You poor dear. You must put your mind at ease.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I will never forgive myself.

dialogues.speaker: MARY,
dialogues.text: You are not to blame, Anna.

dialogues.speaker: AIKEN
dialogues.text: Nor you Mary. It is your son who should be held accountable. Forget what he did to the country. Look at what he's done to your family.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: I assure you, Frederick, we will all be summoned before the judgment bar of God -- where every knee must bend and every tongue confess.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Please, Ma. Let me tell them.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Shhh, my sweet. I've lived a blessed life. 'm at peace with this. One day, when you have a child, you'll understand why it must be this way. (a beat) All I ask is that you be there for your brother -- more than you've ever been. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Promise me.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I'll try, Mother.  105.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Good. Now, let's eat. Aiken turns for the door

dialogues.speaker: MARY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Frederick. It's over. You must stop pursuing John. Is that clear? A beat.

dialogues.text: Catherine is meeting with several SOCIETY WOMEN. We don't know exactly what is being said except that she's arguing with passion -- and seems to be convincing a few.

dialogues.text: As Aiken pleads with Holt, far less successfully.

dialogues.text: The death sentence is signed, Colonel. There's nothing I can do.

dialogues.text: I'm not asking to overturn the verdict -- merely for a stay. So, I can petition for a new trial, in a civil court before a jury of her peers.

dialogues.text: Then, you â€˜ll Have to speak directly with the President. He's the only one who can grant such a delay. Aiken begins to leave. Holt calls out.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT
dialogues.text: Something you wish to tell me, Colonel? Aiken considers, then shakes, No.

dialogues.speaker: HOLT, (CONT'D)

dialogues.text: All I require is a few moments of the President's time.

dialogues.text: We wish to help your client.

dialogues.speaker: CATHERINE
dialogues.text: By petitioning the President on her behalf.

dialogues.text: You're serious. Catherine nods. So do the other women.

dialogues.speaker: AIKEN

dialogues.text: Anna has a look of shock

dialogues.speaker: MARY,

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Let go of her. And she pounces on the soldiers. They quickly restrain An as the Prison Doctor injects her with a sedative.  112.

dialogues.speaker: MARY ANNA
dialogues.text: Please, God. Don't No. Mama. No.... let them hurt her. Anna screams as her mother is being led away. Mary, stric with concern, calls out.

dialogues.text: I love you, darling. Anna crumbles as Aiken catches her

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Proverbs 29:16, Frederick. Promise you won't forget.

dialogues.text: I'll never forgive myself.

dialogues.speaker: AIKEN
dialogues.text: It's ok, Anna. It's ok. Anna gently lays Anna down. The Commandant retrieves Mary white HANDKERCHIEF from the cell floor, and hands it to A

dialogues.text: Proverbs 29:16? Aiken repeats by rote, staring off, in shock

dialogues.speaker: AIKEN

dialogues.text: Aiken rushes past Stanton's AIDE.

dialogues.speaker: STANTON'S AIDE
dialogues.text: Sir, you can't enter without an appointment... Aiken ignores the Aide, and bursts inside STANTON'S OFFIC He finds the War Secretary seemingly OBLIVIOUS to events beyond -- reading a paper, while devouring a hearty break  113.

dialogues.speaker: STANTON
dialogues.text: You're too late, counselor. You had your chance. Stanton's Aide rushes inside.

dialogues.speaker: AIDE
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry, Mr. Secretary. Stanton waves the Aide off.

dialogues.speaker: AIKEN
dialogues.text: For God's sake, she's innocent.

dialogues.speaker: STANTON
dialogues.text: I didn't sentence her, the Court did.

dialogues.speaker: AIKEN
dialogues.text: At your request, no doubt.

dialogues.speaker: STANTON
dialogues.text: Assuming I could, why would I ever choose to do such a thing?

dialogues.speaker: AIKEN
dialogues.text: Revenge.

dialogues.speaker: STANTON
dialogues.text: Goodness, no. I'd never go to such lengths out of vengeance. (a beat) But to assure the safety and security of this nation, indeed, I'd do anything.

dialogues.speaker: AIKEN
dialogues.text: But you want her son.

dialogues.speaker: STANTON
dialogues.text: At this point, I'll settle for either one.

dialogues.speaker: AIKEN
dialogues.text: Like a human sacrifice?

dialogues.speaker: STANTON
dialogues.text: Just think of her as another casualty of war. He points to a stack of CASUALTY PHOTOS from the war.

dialogues.speaker: AIKEN
dialogues.text: On which side?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Union over Disunion.

dialogues.speaker: AIKEN
dialogues.text: Not the Union I fought for. Nor the one Lincoln gave his life to save. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: AIKEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No Union is worth preserving unless it guarantees justice for all.

dialogues.speaker: STANTON
dialogues.text: Words for rallying the troops, Colonel -- Not for running a nation.

dialogues.speaker: AIKEN
dialogues.text: If you permit this injustice, I promise you'll regret the day.

dialogues.speaker: STANTON
dialogues.text: Is that a threat, young man?

dialogues.speaker: AIKEN
dialogues.text: It's a prediction. ...A Slip of PAPER with "MARY SURRATT" written across it.
